definition: single-minded/concentrated
for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized
variant of 專|专[zhuan1]
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
biospecificity

sentences.english: Specifically see the injustice all the way, good to play the powerful Han, as the city is people are afraid of him Jiangzhou.
sentences.chinese: 专一路见不平，好打强汉，以此江州满城人都怕他。

sentences.english: Such single- mindedness is particularly striking given the city's diversity.
sentences.chinese: 考虑到该城的多元性，民众如此专一尤其令人吃惊。

sentences.english: Baculovirus is an specific pathogen for insect, particularly for the Lepidoptera insects.
sentences.chinese: 杆状病毒是昆虫专一性的病原病毒。

sentences.english: The key is single- pointedness of mind.
Your patience indicates that you are a very single-minded man.
sentences.chinese: 你的耐性表明你是一个很专一的人。

sentences.english: The programmed expression of globin genes is tissue and developmental stage specific.
sentences.chinese: 珠蛋白基因的程序性表达是组织发育时期专一性的。

sentences.english: We learn compassion from Guan Yin Bodhisattva and single-minded concentration from Great Strength Bodhisattva.
sentences.chinese: 学观世音菩萨的慈悲，学大势至菩萨的专一。

sentences.english: I sincerely hope that you can use your specific love me this stupid woman.
sentences.chinese: 我真心希望，你能用你的专一去爱我这个笨女人。

sentences.english: This specificity probably resided in the sequence of base pairs along the molecules.
sentences.chinese: 这种专一性可能寄寓在分子的堿基对顺序之中。

sentences.english: The most essential feature of love is its single-minded conern for just one person.
sentences.chinese: 爱情最重要的物质是专一地在意一个人。

sentences.english: Limitations of this study include inability to compare the specificity of these methods.
sentences.chinese: 研究的局限性包括无法比较这些方法的专一性。

sentences.english: Enzymes are highly efficient and specific biochemical catalysts.
sentences.chinese: 酶是高效而专一的生物化学催化剂。

sentences.english: For God is but a great will pervading all things by nature of its intentness .
sentences.chinese: 上帝乃一伟大意志，以其专一之特性遍泽万物。

sentences.english: When practice on Guru Yoga, you should concentrate on praying to your guru.
sentences.chinese: 观修上师瑜伽，宜专一而祈祷。

definition: fickle (in love affairs)/dissipated/unfaithful/heart of a flower (pistil and stamen)
fickle in love/sentimentality
faithful unto death (i.e. Confucian ban on widow remarrying)
concentrating one's thoughts and efforts/single-minded/bent on/intently
lit. say three in the morning but four in the evening (idiom); to change sth that is already settled upon/indecisive/to blow hot and cold
infatuation
loyal and dependable
in two minds about sth (idiom)/half-hearted/shilly-shallying
to cease to be faithful
to change at once on seeing sth different (idiom); loving fads and novelty/never satisfied with what one has
to be hell-bent on/dead set on sth/unswerving
considerate (of other people's needs)
to take care of one's family
unswerving in one's loyalty (idiom); faithful and constant
heartless/without regard for others' feelings
emotion/sentiment/affection/feelings between two persons/CL:個|个[ge4],種|种[zhong3]
